displayed_text: Patient: When do you, when do you wanna start the trial? Doctor: You already got your scan. We start the biopsy. We go. No, no time wasted. Patient: Well I got – I got to do the biopsy? Doctor: Yes! Patient: What the hell, doc? Doctor: Don’t look at me! It’s science! You’re contributing! Patient: You gonna put me to sleep or what? Doctor: Oh, yeah. Yeah. You’ll be fine. Patient: Oh, man! No!!! Doc! C’mon! Doctor: You’ll be fine! Family Member: Seriously? Patient: How you goin’, do whatcha, you goin’ up my ass? What are you doin’?

Patient: There is? Doctor: There is. Yeah, yeah, there's one I think that's purple and I'm pretty sure there's a blue one. Again, I peruse the poop in the mouth aisle, because I don't like to recommend things that you can't get access to. You know, when it sounds good on paper and in the textbooks, and then you go to Meijer, you go to Rite Aid and you're like, “what are you talking about, I've never seen it”. So I will peruse the same store as you guys shop at because if I don't see it then how are you going to play it? So I do know Crest has one that says no alcohol that's a blue and I'm pretty sure Listerine is purple that's a no alcohol, so those are two really good ones. You know I’d still cut it a little bit with the water. Family Member 1: What about toothpaste? Doctor: Same with a lot of the whitening and all that is very harsh on the gums. You know there's Sensodyne, which is very calming. Family Member 1: I have to do a prescription because Doctor: Oh, okay. Family Member 1: Well I’m on blood thinners every day. Patient: So M___ is the next person to come in? Doctor: M____'s coming right in. Family Member 2: Can I ask you a question? Doctor: Yeah. Family Member 2: So he has taken some Ambien once in a while to sleep, is that okay or no?

Patient: Okay. Doctor: We may have at the start of this study. Uh, uh, and it can change with therapy. So, you would have to repeat it again. Um, and you’ve had Enzalutamide, so I think you’d be good to go on that one. Patient: Mm, hmm. Doctor: Uh, that you actually would stay on the Enzalutamide and if you’re AR-V7 positive, well then we have, uh, some of the new list of new therapies that are being used in other tumor types. Patient: Okay. Doctor: And, then, we’re looking to see what they’re likelihood of benefiting men with prostate cancer are. Patient: Okay. Doctor: We have done a handful of men before, and the handful of men seemed to have their PSA drop for awhile. Patient: Mm, hmm. Doctor: But, it’s not the mega excitement in prostate cancer, uh, that we see with the other tumors that you hear on the news with Jimmy Carter and all of those kinds of – Patient: Right, right. Doctor: Um, it can possibly benefit people for awhile.

Patient: Yeah. Chloraseptic. Doctor: That might help. Or when you’re at the drugstore picking up your ibuprofen, there’s liquid saliva. Okay? So like you have the liquid tears. Patient: Um hum. Doctor: There’s artificial saliva. So that if this side of your mouth isn’t making the saliva, you can put some of that in, and just moisten it up. Patient: Okay. Doctor: Okay? Because again, you are sort of, your tongue’s sort of moving over, but your brain looks good. Doctor: Okay? Patient: All right. Doctor: But if it gets worse, it don’t make sense, I’d go back to the ER because I don’t know, because that’s what I would say, and it looks like your tongue’s a little bit more trouble getting over, huh, than the last time. Patient: Okay. I mean, these sometime it’s off and on. Sometimes I can you know- Doctor: Well, when you get tired it can do it. Patient: Yeah. So.
